column4: Somehow I was updating my machine and I did "sudo aptitude dist-upgrade", and aptitude deleted a ton of my packages, including xserver-xorg. How do I reinstall all the default packages?
will that preserve my files? e.g. /home
of course. it's just a metapackage which will have all the default packasges as dependencies
it says that ubuntu-desktop is already the latest version
huh... then try sudo apt-get install --reinstall ubuntu-desktop
it replaces the metapackage but no actual pacages that were lost get installed
hmm.. then i'd sudo apt-get remove --purge ubuntu-desktop, and then sudo apt-get install ubuntu-desktop again
do you have X right now, or are you on console?
hmm to get X again I'd try sudo apt-get install gnome-panel nautilus first, hopefully this will restore a usable gui first
last thing you did was apt-get update and dist-upgrading?
i tend to suggest that... that looks really screwed
you don't need to resize no more, it's done already. go to manual partitioning
